original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.41. Uppannattika, Hetuduka🔽Uppanno hetu dhammo naanupannassa nahetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Uppanno🔽hetu dhammo nauppādissa nahetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Uppanno hetu dhammo
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  uppanna ttika hetu duka  uppannaḥ hetu dhammaḥ na anupannassa na hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ uppannaḥ  hetu dhammo na auppādissa na hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ uppannaḥ hetu dhammo

original: naanuppannassa nahetussa ca nauppādissa nahetussa ca dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na anuppannassa na hetussa ca na auppādissa na hetussa ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A present cause condition is a condition, as cause condition, for a future non-cause condition. A present cause condition is a condition, as cause condition, for a present non-cause condition. A present cause condition is a condition, as cause condition, for a future non-cause condition and for a present non-cause condition.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… sahajāte tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā tīṇi pe sahajāte tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: (In brief.) In the case of cause, there are three; in the case of object, there are nine; in the case of predominance, there are three; … in the case of presence, there are three; … in the case of non-disappearance, there are three.
